question.title: Minimum steps taken by knight to reach target
question.content:
You are given a 2D matrix of size N x N which is nothing but a square chessboard. Given the starting and target positions of the knight, you are supposed to return the minimum number of steps required by the knight to reach the target position from the given starting point.

Note :
Following is the possible movements of the knight from a particular position.

Input Format :
 The first line of input contains an integer 'T' representing the number of the test case. Then the test cases are as follows.

 The first line of each test case contains one integer ‘N’ representing the side of the square chessboard or 2D matrix.

 The second line contains two integers ‘SX’ and ‘SY’ representing the starting position of the knight in the chessboard.

 The third line contains two integers ‘TX’ and ‘TY’ representing the target position in the chessboard.
Output Format :
For each test case, return the minimum number of steps taken by the knight to reach the target position from the given starting position.
Note :
You do not need to print anything; It has already been taken care of.
Constraints :
1 ≤ T ≤ 50
1 ≤ N ≤ 100
1 ≤ SX,SY,TX,TY ≤ 100

Where ‘T’ is the number of test cases.
‘N’ is the side of the given chessboard or matrix.
‘SX’, ‘SY’, ‘TX’, ‘TY’ denotes the starting and target positions in the given chessboard.

Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1 :
2
10
2 3 5 9 
10
1 5 9 8
Sample Output 1 :
3
5
Explanation of Input 1 :
For, first test case, the minimum number of steps taken by the knight to reach the target position is 3.
The steps followed will be starting from (2,3) -> (3,5) -> (4,7) -> (5,9), so in total there are 3 minimum steps that a knight needs to reach target position.

For, second test case, the minimum number of steps taken by the knight to reach the target position is 5.
Sample Input 2 :
2
4
1 2 3 4
4
2 3 4 4
Sample Output 2 :
4
1

rephrased.body: Given a square chessboard of size N x N, find the minimum number of steps a knight needs to reach a target position from a starting position. The knight moves according to the standard L-shape (two steps in one direction and one step perpendicularly). Determine the fewest moves required to reach the destination.
constraints: Where ‘T’ is the number of test cases.
‘N’ is the side of the given chessboard or matrix.
‘SX’, ‘SY’, ‘TX’, ‘TY’ denotes the starting and target positions in the given chessboard.

testcases.explanation: In the first test case, the knight can reach (5, 9) from (2, 3) in 3 moves. One possible path is (2,3) -> (3,5) -> (4,7) -> (5,9).  In the second test case, the knight requires 5 moves to go from (1, 5) to (9, 8).

In the first test case, starting from (1,2) in a 4x4 board and going to (3,4) requires 4 moves. In the second test case, it takes 1 move for a knight to travel from (2,3) to (4,4) on a 4x4 chessboard.

hints: Try to think of all the possible 8 positions where the knight can reach from the current position.
Check whether the results are different in the case if the knight and the target positions are in the same rows or columns.
